### Future Fighter Capability Project - Economic Benefits Engagement

#### Reference and Solicitation Information
- **Reference Number**: PW-_NGF-002-29024
- **Solicitation Number**: W847A-180210/C
- **Publication Date**: 2023-03-27
- **Tender Closing Date**: 2024-04-25T14:00:00

#### Project Overview
The Future Fighter Capability Project (FFCP) is a procurement initiative by the Government of Canada to acquire 88 F-35A fighter jets, associated equipment, sustainment setup, and services. The project's objective is to enhance the Canadian Armed Forces' combat capability and strengthen its partnership with the United States Government.

#### Industry Engagement Session
A Virtual Industry Engagement Session was held on June 5, 2023, to inform Canadian industry stakeholders about the FFCP's implementation, including project timelines, economic benefits approach, sustainment plan, and key contacts. Representatives from Public Services and Procurement Canada, Department of National Defence, Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada, the United States Government, Lockheed Martin, and Pratt & Whitney participated in the session.

#### Registration and Communication
Registration for the Virtual Industry Engagement Session was accepted up to May 31, 2023, through an online form linked below:

https://forms.office.com/r/9JwWZR8Cs5

Participants were required to provide their organization name, representative name, email address, and telephone number. Additional questions can be directed to ffcp-pcfac@ised-isde.gc.ca.

#### Document Availability
Presentation decks and live recordings of the Virtual Industry Engagement Session are available in both official languages upon request to ffcp-pcfac@ised-isde.gc.ca.

#### Note
The Government of Canada continues to seek industry feedback regarding the FFCP after the Virtual Industry Engagement Session. Feedback can be submitted through the following web link:

https://forms.office.com/r/kZ3FEtWz60.

#### Award
On January 9, 2023, the Government of Canada announced that an arrangement had been concluded with the United States Government, Lockheed Martin, and Pratt & Whitney for the acquisition of the fighter jets and associated equipment.

#### Procurement Details
- **Competitive Procurement Strategy**: N/A - Public-Private Partnership/ Letter of Intention Only
- **Trade Agreement**: NONE
- **Nature of Requirements**: FFCP acquisition of 88 F-35A fighter jets and associated equipment
